titleStmt.title: The independency of England endeavored to be maintained by Henry Marten, a member of the Parliament there, against the claim of the Scottish Commissioners, in their late ansvver upon the bills and propostions sent to the King in the Isle of Wight.
titleStmt.author: Marten, Henry, 1602-1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Peter Cole, at the Printing-Press in Cornhil, near the Royal-Exchange, and John Sweeting, at the Angel in Popes-head Alley,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Jan: 11th 1647"; the "8" in the imprint has been crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Printing-Press in Cornhil, near the Royal-Exchange
